channel.title: Technical Devlog on Pandaqi Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Technical Devlog on Pandaqi Blog

item.title: Less is Store
item.description: Welcome to the devlog for “Less is Store”. This game was created for the GoGodot Jam (iteration 4).

item.title: Own Goals Not Allowed
item.description: Welcome to this really short devlog for my game “Own Goals Not Allowed”. (Previously called Splitball in my notes.

item.title: Carving Pumpkins & Dwarfing Dumplings
item.description: Welcome to the devlog for my game Carving Pumpkins & Dwarfing Dumplings I’m going to try to keep this one shorter than usual, as this game is basically a spinoff from another game I was making.

item.title: Rolling in the Sheepe
item.description: Welcome to my devlog for the game “Sheepe”, otherwise known as Rolling in the Sheepe The idea was simple: everyone is a sheep in a random shape, you can only roll yourself, and the first to reach the finish wins.

item.title: Windup Wizards
item.description: Alright, so, the GoGodot Jam 2 happened. I decided to participate. This was decided well in advance, and I scheduled my other projects around it.

item.title: Ho Ho Sombrero
item.description: Welcome to my devlog for the game “Ho Ho Sombrero” At the start of December, the “New Horizons” game jam came on my radar.

item.title: Windowsilk
item.description: Welcome to my devlog for the game Windowsilk A local multiplayer game for 1-X players, playing spiders moving across an increasingly chaotic web, catching bugs and avoiding falling off their web.

item.title: Unstable Universe (Part 3)
item.description: Welcome to part 3 of the technical devlog. Haven’t read the other entries? Go to the devlog overview.

item.title: Unstable Universe (Part 2)
item.description: Welcome to part 2 of the technical devlog. Haven’t read the other entries? Go to the devlog overview.

item.title: Unstable Universe (Part 1)
item.description: Welcome to the technical devlog about Unstable Universe! If you haven’t yet looked at the game or played it, make sure to do so, otherwise what I talk about in this article won’t make much sense.

item.title: Timely Transports (Part 3)
item.description: In part 2 I explained 50% of the algorithms/ideas needed to generate a random board. In this part I explain the other half!

item.title: Timely Transports (Part 2)
item.description: In part 1 I outlined the difficulties with what I was trying to do (combine a boardgame and smartphone, and generate random boards), but also why I want to do it.

item.title: Timely Transports (Part 1)
item.description: Welcome to the technical devlog for Timely Transports Timely Transports is the first ever hybrid board + smartphone game.

item.title: Wondering Witches (Part 5)
item.description: Welcome to part 5 of my Technical Devlog for the game Wondering Witches! Haven’t read the other entries? Go to the devlog overview.

item.title: Wondering Witches (Part 4)
item.description: Welcome to part 4 of my Technical Devlog for the game Wondering Witches! Haven’t read the other entries? Go to the devlog overview.

item.title: Wondering Witches (Part 3)
item.description: Welcome to part 3 of my Technical Devlog for the game Wondering Witches! Haven’t read the other entries? Go to the devlog overview.

item.title: Wondering Witches (Part 2)
item.description: Welcome to part 2 of my Technical Devlog for the game Wondering Witches! Haven’t read the other entries? Go to the devlog overview.

item.title: Wondering Witches (Part 1)
item.description: Welcome to the technical devlog of Wondering Witches! In case you haven’t played it yet, visit Wondering Witches (Game Page).

item.title: Boltcorpse & Sons
item.description: Welcome to my devlog for the video game Boltcorpse & Sons. It will be quite brief, because it was for a very short game jam (The Jame Gam 33) and I had no time to actually track this diary while making the game.

item.title: Bombgoggles
item.description: Welcome to my devlog for the game Bombgoggles. It will be a very brief one, because it’s a very short jam (it’s literally called the Mini Jam) and I can’t even use most of the time we do get.

item.title: Bot Bouldering
item.description: Welcome to the devlog for one of my ideas for the GMTK Jam 2024. It was a mess, things weren’t working, and I’ll be documenting it all because it helps me think through the problems.

item.title: Druids in the Dark
item.description: Welcome to my devlog for the game Druids in the Dark. It was made for a Game Jam (by PirateSoftware) in very little time, because I was too busy finishing other projects.

item.title: Finside Out & Inside Sprout
item.description: Welcome to my devlog for the game jam called So you WANNA Jam!? 2024. The jam was held from August 3th to August 12th by the YouTuber/Game Developer Wannibe Manisha.

item.title: Sunbluck
item.description: Welcome to my devlog for the game Sunbluck. It was made for the Godot Wild Jam 72 in a few days, which is why this devlog will be rather brief.
